Helping Hands for Freedom Puts on Freedom To Rock EventHelping Hands for Freedom is a nation-wide nonprofit organization that helps support military children and families facing loss, injury, and deployment. One of the events that Helping Hands for Freedom is putting on is called Freedom to Rock. Proceeds for this event will benefit children and families of our heroes that have put their lives on the line for our country.Freedom to Rock will be a night full of awesome 80’s music, live auctions, food, and comedy. Again, the proceeds for Freedom to Rock directly helps the families of our heroes!visit https://lnkd.in/gx4eGab

Our Scottsdale Venues are privately owned and operated. We offer An Exceptional Unique And Private Experience. As opposed to disallowing parties and gatherings, we applaud them.  Outsiders and meandering hotel guests during a reception, reunion, or sumptuous event just don’t mix well. At one of our private Scottsdale Venues you won’t have another tipsy guest wander over and will never have to compete for a spot at your own private bar. Venues of North Scottsdale offer extreme privacy with no foot traffic!Guidelines are unavoidable; however, how many rules is what matters. We’ve found hotels and resorts to often hand clients an complete book of rules and limitations before planning of the corporate event has even begun. When it comes to private venues, you’re do business with people, not brochures or rule books. So, while safeguarding our venues is of our topmost importance, we’ll not ever freak you out with files of limitations and fine print.

WPG knows that it takes a lot of different components to create a great event. In addition to high quality staging, structures and tents, WPG offers a full range of event support products and accessories. We own and maintain an impressive inventory of these products at our warehouse.Event Coordinators will take your design from the Event Planning stage and turn it into reality with the help of our Production team. It may look simple on paper, but this is where you need the best to get the best. The devil is in the details, as they say, and WPG's team are virtual angels in this jungle of minutiae.Let us guide you to success by putting on the show of a lifetime. Corporate Events are our specialty, but we love anything that has Lights and Sound! Our Stage Rentals will put your event on the map when your performance is emphasized with our cutting-edge equipment.Event Management is critical to the seamless execution of any event, be it corporate theater, a general session or multiple break out sessions. Every member of our team is a superior communicator who never rests until every detail has been confirmed, handled and checked off with confidence.Contact us to see how we can deliver this global excellence for your upcoming events today!Specialties: Concert Staging, Event Staging & Platforms, Structure type tents, event rental supplies, tables, chairs, fencing, climate control.OTHER PRODUCTS LISTLightingFlooringCarpet, TurfDance FloorsHeatingCoolingTablesChairsLinensFurnishingsDécorFencingSound Systems/PAGame Systems/Pool TablesBleachers/SeatingStagingStaging is our specialty. Whether you are planning a private party, a product launch, a festival or fashion show, or a major concert tour, no one does staging better than W Production Group.

President 2013International Special Events Society, Arizona ChapterISES is a professional society dedicated to the special events industry. The organization was founded in 1987 to foster enlightened performance through education while promoting ethical conduct. ISES has grown to include over 7,200 professionals in over 49 chapters globally. The solid peer network ISES provides helps special event professionals produce outstanding results for clients while establishing positive working relationships with colleagues. ISES unites us as an industry, is an invaluable resource and provides ongoing opportunities for professional development and recognition.

Dear friends of four legged fuzzy loving animals:Each year in Arizona, hundreds of animal rescue groups and shelters receive thousands of homeless dogs and cats and provide a variety of services to them. These services are all provided and paid for by each individual rescue. They are responsible for obtaining their own operating funds. They raise the money they need to help animals in several ways, mostly through the huge hearts of their volunteers. Volunteers are the backbone of any non-profit organization. Non-profit organizations keep their doors open through the generosity of people and businesses that share the vision of a world without any unwanted pets. They each have teams of veterinarians who perform lifesaving surgeries, as well as countless spay and neuter procedures, saving lives and preventing unwanted ones from coming into this world. While they would like to spend all of their time matching needy pets to loving families, they are forced to put a great deal of time and effort into raising funds to cover the usual expenses: food, puppy pads, kitty litter; medical supplies and drugs; laundry and cleaning products, office supplies, gasoline to transport the animals, and countless other necessities that keep their facility running and their pets comfortable. This work requires a major financial commitment. Charitable donations are of great importance when it comes to funding our operating needs. Your gifts are of huge importance to us.  Anything you can contribute – goods, services, gift cards or certificates – will enable us to raise funds to keep the dream alive.  The animals and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your help.

Mission StatementTo rescue, rehabilitate and rehome discarded breeding dogs and to educate the general public about the cruel realities of the commercial dog breeding industry.We are a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization Why We Do What We DoNational Mill Dog Rescue was established in February 2007, in honor of a forgiving little Italian Greyhound named Lily. Theresa Strader, NMDR’s Founder and Executive Director, rescued Lily from a dog auction in Missouri. Prior to that day, Lily had spent the first seven years of her life as a commercial breeding dog, a puppy mill mom. Determined that her years of living in misery would not be in vain, Strader started NMDR, giving a voice to mill dogs across the country.Strader brought Lily and twelve others home from the auction and declares that even for a highly seasoned rescuer, the following months were the education of a lifetime in rehabilitation. That she would take up the cause for the mill dogs was never in question and National Mill Dog Rescue was promptly underway. In five short years, NMDR has amassed over 1,300 volunteers and has rescued over 8,400 puppy mill survivors.Run almost solely by volunteers, NMDR has pledged to put an end to the cruelty of the puppy mill industry. Through widespread informative efforts, NMDR hopes to educate the public to acquire their companion animals through reputable breeders or better yet, from shelters and rescue groups across the country.

summary: Our venues host some of the best...Corporate events, brand launches, private parties, experiential events, parties, reunions, shindigs…you name it we are the coolest hippest venues in North Scottsdale!  14 spaces from 3500 feet to 35,000 one hangar is like you just walked into Las Vegas.Located in Scottsdale we are the Valley’s newest event venue’s. It is the ideal destination for creating the most memorable corporate or social events in Scottsdale. Industrial venues give you plenty of opportunity to make a space your own. This previous year we’ve observed a lot of great corporate event trends, but one of our favorites, by far, is the increase in popularity of hangar venues. For many years, people have been holding secret parties in cool warehouse spaces and abandoned buildings. But this year we’ve seen the concept move mainstream, hangars. Hangar spaces are being used for all types of events, from corporate dinner parties to music performances; and most notably incentive events.A fresh, more leading-edge form of social entertainment has been growing in status over the last few years, with the rise of immersive experiences. They have become the “must have” thing for social entertaining, and we wholly expect their attractiveness to continue to grow.  The test will be for all of us in the events industry vendor or planner will to be to make our events as electrifying, mystifying and immersive as imaginable. Truly immersive experiences are all about producing wonder, anticipation and a real “wow” effect. In this highly connected world, the amount of ambiguity and amazement is increasingly scarce, and what guests at immersive experiences enjoy is being plunged into a absolutely outlandish state where they might end up in the middle of a flash mob or a panic room with no way out but to find the way.
name: Karen L. May
